intro: Melandrium chilense var. cucubaloides, commonly known as the Chilean sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer.
